title: Months lapse for Govt, state bungalows still lie idle
byline: State bungalows which were assigned to Cabinet Ministers as their official residences in the past currently remain idle under the current government even after months despite its pre-election promise to repurpose them for economically viable activities.

title: Trump deploys National Guard as Los Angeles protests against immigration agents continue
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration said it would deploy 2,000 National Guard troops on Saturday as federal agents in Los Angeles faced off against a few hundred demonstrators during a second day of protests following immigration raids.

title: Showery conditions expected across Southwestern Sri Lanka from tomorrow
byline: Showery conditions are expected to intensify in the southwestern part of the island from tomorrow (10), accompanied by strong wind gusts over the island and in the surrounding sea areas, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Govt to recruit retired soldiers to Police
byline: The Ministry of Public Security plans to recruit 10,000 individuals under the age of 45 who have legally retired from active military service into the police force.

title: 10-hour water cut for Gampaha district
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board has announced a 10-hour water cut scheduled for Wednesday (June 11), affecting multiple areas in the Gampaha District.

title: Trump’s tumble on Air Force One goes viral
byline: Trump Latest | Trump Tumbles On Air Force One Goes Viral, Internet Compares It To Joe Biden’s Fall US President Donald Trump stumbled on the stairs of Air Force One on Sunday (Jun 8) ahead of departure from Morristown Municipal Airport in Morristown, New Jersey.

title: Wife of former State Minister arrested over Rs. 700 Mn tax evasion
byline: Kushani Nanayakkara, a businesswoman and the wife of former State Minister Dunesh Gankanda, has been arrested by the Central Crimes Investigation Bureau (CCIB) following an open warrant issued over a longstanding income tax evasion case filed by the Inland Revenue Department.

title: Water board recovers SMS system after security breach
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced that the recent security breach of its SMS communication system has been fully recovered, though it will take a few more days to restore the NWSDB SelfCare mobile app, officials said.

title: Bribery Commission gets new Investigations Director
byline: Fifteen police personnel, including five senior officers, have been transferred or appointed with immediate effect, following the approval of the National Police Commission.

title: Emergency hotline introduced for Poson pilgrims to Polonnaruwa
byline: An emergency contact number has been introduced for devotees undertaking pilgrimages to Polonnaruwa during the Poson Week, the Poson Event Committee in Anuradhapura said

title: Special train services for Poson pilgrims until June 12
byline: The Sri Lanka Railways has launched special train services from Colombo Fort to Anuradhapura and Mihintale to facilitate devotees traveling for Poson Poya observances.

title: Udaya Gammanpila arrives at CID
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning to provide a statement in connection with the controversial release of 323 shipping containers.

title: Local Pharma industry sounds alarm on potential drug shortage
byline: In light of the acute shortage of essential medicines, the Sri Lanka Chamber of the Pharmaceutical Industry (SLCPI) is urging the Ministry of Health to act immediately and to rethink its reliance on Government-to-Government (G2G) procurement warning that it may come too late to meet urgent needs.

title: Impose price control on masks, sanitisers amid fresh crisis: Asela Sampath
byline: The National Consumers’ Front chairman, Asela Sampath, today urged the government to immediately impose a controlled price on surgical face masks and hand sanitisers as the country faces a fresh critical situation.

title: Trump deploys National Guard as Los Angeles protests against immigration agents continue
byline: President Donald Trump’s administration said it would deploy 2,000 National Guard troops on Saturday as federal agents in Los Angeles faced off against a few hundred demonstrators during a second day of protests following immigration raids.

title: Showery conditions expected to increase from tomorrow
byline: Showery conditions are expected to intensify in the southwestern part of the island from tomorrow (10), accompanied by strong wind gusts over the island and in the surrounding sea areas, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Fishermen, naval communities urged to remain vigilant as rough seas expected
byline: The Meteorology Department has issued a special advisory, requesting naval and fishing communities to exercise caution when venturing out to sea, as the active southwest monsoon conditions continue to affect several coastal areas around the island.

title: Prisons chief suspended over alleged misuse of Presidential pardons
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has decided to suspend Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya over allegations of the unauthorised release of inmates under the pretence of a Presidential pardon.

title: President Dissanayake to undertake official visit to Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake will undertake an official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany from 11 to 13 June 20, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Court orders probe on false 119 tip-off against female library officer
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Manjula Rathnayake ordered the Cinnamon Gardens Police to conduct an investigation and report to the court regarding a false tip-off made to the 119 Police Emergency Response Unit, alleging that a female officer of the Colombo Public Library was carrying illegal drugs in her handbag.

title: KKS railway station to be extended: Transport Minister
byline: In a significant move to boost transport infrastructure in the Northern Province, the Transport Ministry and the Railways Department are working to extend the Kankesanthurai (KKS) railway line to a new industrial estate currently under development in the area.

title: RCB moves Karnataka HC to quash criminal case against it over Bengaluru stampede
byline: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) on Monday approached the Karnataka High Court seeking to quash the criminal case registered against them in connection with the stampede at M. Chinnaswamy Stadium on June 4, which left 11 people dead and several others injured.

title: Court acquits suspect accused of reprinting ’Ranamaga Osse Nandikadal’
byline: Colombo Additional Magistrate Pasan Amarasinghe acquitted a suspect accused of illegally printing and selling copies of the book ’Ranamaga Osse Nandikadal’ authored by former Defence Secretary Major General Kamal Gunaratne, without the author’s consent.

title: Gammanpila publicizes list of controversial containers
byline: Leader of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya, Udaya Gammanpila today revealed the detailed list of controversial shipping containers released by Sri Lanka Customs earlier this year.

title: Mahindananda files appeal against carom board judgment
byline: Former Sports Minister Mahindananda Aluthgamage, who was sentenced to 20 years of rigorous imprisonment by the Colombo High Court Trial-at-Bar, has filed an appeal before the Supreme Court challenging the legality of the judgment delivered on May 29.

title: Udaya Gammanpila leaves CID
byline: Former Minister Udaya Gammanpila left the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) a short while ago after recording a statement in connection with the controversial release of 323 shipping containers.

title: Fugitive mastermind in South Asia’s largest VAT scam attempts to reopen case in CA: AG
byline: The Supreme Court today issued an immediate stay order halting further proceedings in the Court of Appeal concerning the 8th accused in South Asia’s largest Value Added Tax (VAT) fraud case.

title: Ranil summoned to CID tomorrow
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been summoned to the CID tomorrow, his office said in a statement.

title: Police sergeant remanded for allegedly soliciting Rs.10,000 bribe
byline: A police sergeant attached to the Kinniya Police Station was ordered to be remanded till June 23 for allegedly soliciting a bribe of Rs. 10,000 in order to refrain from taking legal action against an individual riding a motorcycle without a valid driving license.

title: ASPI continues record-breaking rally, sustains momentum above 17,500
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) began the week on a positive note, despite a decline during the first hours of trading. However, the market regained strong momentum as the session progressed, with the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassing the 17,500 mark for the first time in history.

title: Railways Dept. launches special assistance programme for disabled passengers
byline: The Railways Department has announced the introduction of a new system aimed at providing special assistance to disabled passengers travelling by train.

title: GMOA warns of rising respiratory illnesses, urges public to wear facemasks
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) today cautioned the public about a noticeable increase in respiratory illnesses within the community and urged people to wear facemasks, particularly when attending large gatherings or interacting with many individuals.

title: Ravi Kumudesh suspended
byline: Medical Laboratory Technologist and prominent trade union activist Ravi Kumudesh has been suspended from service, effective June 10, 2025.

title: Singapore cargo ship catches fire en route from Colombo to Mumbai
byline: An explosion was reported on board the Singapore-flagged container ship MV Wan Hai 503 off the coast of Kerala on Monday morning, a Defence PRO said.

title: Impose price control on face masks, sanitisers amid fresh crisis: Asela Sampath
byline: The National Consumers’ Front chairman, Asela Sampath, today urged the government to immediately impose a controlled price on surgical face masks and hand sanitisers as the country faces a fresh critical situation.

title: NPP’s Vraie Balthazaar questioned for jumping the gun
byline: The recent inspection tour conducted by Vraie Balthazaar - who has been nominated by the National People’s Power (NPP) as the Mayor of Colombo Municipal Council, is mired in controversy, with the opposition questioning how she could act out as mayor even before the municipal administration is formed.

title: Dengue rises, not at alarming levels
byline: The number of reported dengue cases crossed the 25,000 mark yesterday, and fatalities stood at 13, up from six last month, Dr. Prescila Samaraweera of the National Dengue Control Unit told the Daily Mirror.

title: Mudslinging campaign launched once again by opponents: Dr. Bellana
byline: Colombo National Hospital Deputy Director Dr. Rukshan Bellana denied reports circulating on social media claiming that he has been removed from the post of Director General of the National Blood Transfusion Service.

title: Suspended Prisons Chief Thushara Upuldeniya arrested
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons, Thushara Upuldeniya, has been arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Namal says AKD must realize he is President, must value his signature
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa has criticized President Anura Dissanayake accusing him of failing to take responsibility for a controversial prisoner pardon issued during Vesak.

title: Ranil to be summoned to CID on Wednesday
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been summoned to the CID on Wednesday (11), his office said in a statement.
